definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Red fire ants like these in the American south have gotten a bad rap in our world.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，南美洲出现的这种红火蚁已经是声名狼藉。

sentences.english: He was notorious as a gambler and rake.
sentences.chinese: 他是声名狼藉的赌徒和浪荡子。

sentences.english: Scandals at some of the biggest comités d’entreprise have given all a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 一些最大的企业委员会的丑闻已声名狼藉。

sentences.english: The Parliament was in bad odour among the people.
sentences.chinese: 该国议会在百姓心目中已是声名狼藉。

sentences.english: She achieved notoriety for her affair with the senator.
sentences.chinese: 她因为和参议员的风流韵事而声名狼藉。

sentences.english: Ellison's most notorious romance ended up in court.
sentences.chinese: 埃里森最为声名狼藉的罗曼史终结于法庭。

sentences.english: Pride breakfasted with Plenty, dined with Poverty, and supped with Infamy .
sentences.chinese: 骄者往往早餐丰盛，午餐寒酸，晚餐时声名狼藉。

sentences.english: Washington's financial institutions were once notorious for their dogmatic prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿的金融机构曾因它们教条的处方而声名狼藉。

sentences.english: It is a louche night club.
sentences.chinese: 这是个声名狼藉的晚间俱乐部。

sentences.english: His reputation stunk for obscenities to a maiden.
sentences.chinese: 他因猥亵一名少女而声名狼藉。

sentences.english: His abrasive manner has won him an unenviable notoriety.
sentences.chinese: 他生硬粗暴的态度让他声名狼藉。

sentences.english: When was the infamous person sent to prison?
sentences.chinese: 那是前苏联声名狼藉的机构。

sentences.english: Notoriety is often mistaken for fame.
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉常被误认为鼎鼎大名。

definition: to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
to spit on and curse/to revile
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
